title: Ticket #3529: Multiple file transfer worker threads can crash daemon
description:
The FileTransfer object keeps a hash table to track child processes created to perform transfers. A pointer to the hash table is a static member of FileTransfer. An entry is inserted when a child process is created and removed when a child process is reaped. Whenever a FileTransfer object is created, the hash table allocated if it isn't already. When a FileTransfer object is destroyed, the hash table is also destroyed (and the pointer set to NULL) if it doesn't have any entries.

If a daemon creates two FileTransfer objects, deletes one, then creates a child process to perform a transfer for the other object, the process crashes due to a NULL pointer deference.

We should leave the hash table in place once it's created, never deleting it. The amount of memory used by an empty table is tiny.

This problem was first observed in the condor_gridmanager and condor_ft-gahp with Bosco. Everywhere else in HTCondor, no more than one FileTransfer object is in existence at a time. (Well, also the transfer daemon, but that's not used.)
